name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED ACQUISITION
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED HOLD
description: returns whether airspeed hold is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED HOLD CURRENT
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED HOLD VAR
description: Returns the target holding airspeed for the autopilot.

name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED MAX CALCULATED
description: Returns the maximum calculated airspeed (kcas) limit set for the autopilot.

name: AUTOPILOT AIRSPEED MIN CALCULATED
description: Returns the minimum calculated airspeed (kcas) limit set for the autopilot.

name: AUTOPILOT ALT RADIO MODE
description: If enabled the Autopilot will use the Radio Altitude rather than the Indicated Altitude.

name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE ARM
description: Returns whether the autopilot is in Altitude Arm mode (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE LOCK
description: Altitude hold active

name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE LOCK VAR
description: Set or get the slot index which the altitude hold mode will track when captured. See alt_mode_slot_index for more information.

name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE MANUALLY TUNABLE
description: Whether or not the autopilot altitude is manually tunable or not.

name: AUTOPILOT ALTITUDE SLOT INDEX
description:
Index of the slot that the autopilot will use for the altitude reference. Note that there are 3 slots (1, 2, 3) that you can set/get normally, however you can also target slot index 0. Writing to slot 0 will overwrite all other slots with the slot 0 value, and by default the autopilot will follow slot 0 if you have not selected any slot index.
See alt_mode_slot_index for more information.

name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH ACTIVE
description: When true, the autopilot is currently flying the approach Flight Plan (the last legs).

name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH ARM
description: Returns true when the autopilot is active on the approach, once it reaches the adequate condition (in most cases, once it reaches the second-last waypoint of the flightplan).

name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH CAPTURED
description: Returns true when the lateral NAV mode is engaged and the angular deviation with the current tuned navigation frequency is less than 5°.

name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH HOLD
description: Returns whether pproach mode is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT APPROACH IS LOCALIZER
description: Returns true if the current approach is using a localizer.

name: AUTOPILOT ATTITUDE HOLD
description: Attitude hold active

name: AUTOPILOT AVAILABLE
description: Available flag

name: AUTOPILOT AVIONICS MANAGED
description: Returns whether the autopilot has active managed avionics (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT BACKCOURSE HOLD
description: Returns whether the autopilot back course mode is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT BANK HOLD
description: Returns whether the autopilot bank hold mode is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT BANK HOLD REF
description:
The current bank-hold bank reference.
Note that if you set this, the next frame the value will be overwritten by the engine, so you may need to write to this every game frame to ensure it maintains the required value.

name: AUTOPILOT CRUISE SPEED HOLD
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: AUTOPILOT DEFAULT PITCH MODE
description: The current default pitch mode of the autopilot as configured in the plane configuration with the parameter default_pitch_mode.
unit:
Enum:

0 = None
1 = Pitch
2 = Altitude Hold
3 = Vertical Speed

name: AUTOPILOT DEFAULT ROLL MODE
description: The current default roll mode of the autopilot as configured in the plane configuration with the parameter default_bank_mode.
unit:
Enum:

0 = None
1 = Wing Leveler
2 = Heading
3 = Roll Hold

name: AUTOPILOT DISENGAGED
description: Returns whether the autopilot has been disengaged (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT FLIGHT DIRECTOR ACTIVE
description: Flight director active

name: AUTOPILOT FLIGHT DIRECTOR BANK
description: Reference bank angle

name: AUTOPILOT FLIGHT DIRECTOR BANK EX1
description: Raw reference bank angle

name: AUTOPILOT FLIGHT DIRECTOR PITCH
description: Reference pitch angle

name: AUTOPILOT FLIGHT DIRECTOR PITCH EX1
description: Raw reference pitch angle

name: AUTOPILOT FLIGHT LEVEL CHANGE
description: Boolean, toggles the autopilot Flight Level Change mode

name: AUTOPILOT GLIDESLOPE ACTIVE
description: When true, the autopilot is receiving a signal from the runway beacon and is following the slope to reach the ground.

name: AUTOPILOT GLIDESLOPE ARM
description: Returns true when the autopilot is active on the glide slope.

name: AUTOPILOT GLIDESLOPE HOLD
description: Returns whether the autopilot glidslope hold is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT HEADING LOCK
description: Returns whether the autopilot heading lock is enabled (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT HEADING LOCK DIR
description: Specifies / Returns the locked in heading for the autopilot.

name: AUTOPILOT HEADING MANUALLY TUNABLE
description: Whether or not the autopilot heading is manually tunable or not.

name: AUTOPILOT HEADING SLOT INDEX
description: Index of the slot that the autopilot will use for the heading reference. Note that there are 3 slots (1, 2, 3) that you can set/get normally, however you can also target slot index 0. Writing to slot 0 will overwrite all other slots with the slot 0 value, and by default the autopilot will follow slot 0 if you have not selected any slot index.

name: AUTOPILOT MACH HOLD
description: Mach hold active

name: AUTOPILOT MACH HOLD VAR
description: Returns the target holding mach airspeed for the autopilot.

name: AUTOPILOT MANAGED INDEX
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: AUTOPILOT MANAGED SPEED IN MACH
description: Returns whether the managed speed is in mach (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT MANAGED THROTTLE ACTIVE
description: Returns whether the autopilot managed throttle is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT MASTER
description: On/off flag

name: AUTOPILOT MAX BANK
description: Returns the maximum banking angle for the autopilot, in radians.

name: AUTOPILOT MAX BANK ID
description: Returns the index of the current maximum bank setting of the autopilot.

name: AUTOPILOT MAX SPEED HOLD
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: AUTOPILOT NAV1 LOCK
description: Returns TRUE (1) if the autopilot Nav1 lock is applied, or 0 (FALSE) otherwise.

name: AUTOPILOT NAV SELECTED
description: Index of Nav radio selected

name: AUTOPILOT PITCH HOLD
description: Set to True if the autopilot pitch hold has is engaged.

name: AUTOPILOT PITCH HOLD REF
description: Returns the current autotpilot reference pitch.

name: AUTOPILOT RPM HOLD
description: True if autopilot rpm hold applied

name: AUTOPILOT RPM HOLD VAR
description: Selected rpm

name: AUTOPILOT RPM SLOT INDEX
description: Index of the slot that the autopilot will use for the RPM reference. Note that there are 3 slots (1, 2, 3) that you can set/get normally, however you can also target slot index 0. Writing to slot 0 will overwrite all other slots with the slot 0 value, and by default the autopilot will follow slot 0 if you have not selected any slot index.

name: AUTOPILOT SPEED SETTING
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: AUTOPILOT SPEED SLOT INDEX
description: Index of the managed references

name: AUTOPILOT TAKEOFF POWER ACTIVE
description: Takeoff / Go Around power mode active

name: AUTOPILOT THROTTLE ARM
description: Returns whether the autopilot auto-throttle is armed (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE).

name: AUTOPILOT THROTTLE MAX THRUST
description: This can be used to set/get the thrust lever position for autopilot maximum thrust.

name: AUTOPILOT VERTICAL HOLD
description: True if autopilot vertical hold applied

name: AUTOPILOT VERTICAL HOLD VAR
description: Selected vertical speed

name: AUTOPILOT VS SLOT INDEX
description: Index of the slot that the autopilot will use for the VS reference. Note that there are 3 slots (1, 2, 3) that you can set/get normally, however you can also target slot index 0. Writing to slot 0 will overwrite all other slots with the slot 0 value, and by default the autopilot will follow slot 0 if you have not selected any slot index.

name: AUTOPILOT WING LEVELER
description: Wing leveler active

name: AUTOPILOT YAW DAMPER
description: Yaw damper active

name: ASSISTANCE LANDING ENABLED
description: Returns whether landing assistance has been enabled or not.

name: ASSISTANCE TAKEOFF ENABLED
description: Returns whether takeoff assistance has been enabled or not.

name: AI ANTISTALL STATE
description: The current state of the AI anti-stall system.

name: AI AUTOTRIM ACTIVE
description: Returns whether the AI auto-trim system is enabled or not.

name: AI AUTOTRIM ACTIVE AGAINST PLAYER
description: Returns whether the AI auto-trim system is enabled or not for AI controlled aircraft.

name: AI CONTROLS
description: Returns whether the AI control system is enabled or not.

name: AI CURSOR MODE ACTIVE
description: Returns whether the AI cursor mode is active or not.

name: ATTITUDE BARS POSITION
description: AI reference pitch reference bars

name: ATTITUDE CAGE
description: AI caged state

name: ATTITUDE INDICATOR BANK DEGREES
description: AI bank indication

name: ATTITUDE INDICATOR PITCH DEGREES
description: AI pitch indication

name: DELEGATE CONTROLS TO AI
description: Returns whether the AI control system is active or not.

name: FLY ASSISTANT CANCEL DESTINATION
description: When set with any value this will cancel the current flight assistant destination.

name: FLY ASSISTANT CANCEL DESTINATION DISPLAY
description: When set with any value this will cancel the display of the current flight assistant destination.

name: FLY ASSISTANT COM AI LOCKED
description: Returns true when the copilot AI control is active and therefore COM AI is locked on active too.

name: FLY ASSISTANT HAVE DESTINATION
description: Returns true when a destination has been set in the flight assistant.

name: FLY ASSISTANT LANDING SPEED
description: Returns the POH range or an estimated value for this speed.

name: FLY ASSISTANT LANDING SPEED DISPLAY MODE
description: Returns the display mode of the speed, CSS side (only STALL SPEED is working and will turn red when below).

name: FLY ASSISTANT NEAREST CATEGORY
description: Selected category

name: FLY ASSISTANT NEAREST COUNT
description: Number of elements in this category

name: FLY ASSISTANT NEAREST METADATA
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: FLY ASSISTANT NEAREST NAME
description: Returns the name of the element at the specified index.

name: FLY ASSISTANT NEAREST SELECTED
description: Returns the index of the currently selected element.

name: FLY ASSISTANT RIBBONS ACTIVE
description: Returns true when both ribbon assistances are active (taxi and landing), and can also be used to set them.

name: FLY ASSISTANT SET AS DESTINATION
description: When set with any value, it will set the selected element as the current destination.

name: FLY ASSISTANT STALL SPEED
description: Returns the flight assistant stall speed.

name: FLY ASSISTANT STALL SPEED DISPLAY MODE
description: Returns the flight assistant stall speed display mode.

name: FLY ASSISTANT TAKEOFF SPEED
description: Returns the flight assistant takeoff speed.

name: FLY ASSISTANT TAKEOFF SPEED DISPLAY MODE
description: Returns the flight assistant takeoff speed display mode.

name: FLY ASSISTANT TAKEOFF SPEED ESTIMATED
description: Can be set to override the estimated takeoff speed

name: ANTISKID BRAKES ACTIVE
description: True if antiskid brakes active. This can be set using the AntiSkidActive parameter.

name: AUTOBRAKES ACTIVE
description: Whether or not the AutoBrakes are currently active.

name: AUTO BRAKE SWITCH CB
description: Auto brake switch position

name: BRAKE DEPENDENT HYDRAULIC PRESSURE
description: Brake dependent hydraulic pressure reading

name: BRAKE INDICATOR
description: Brake on indication

name: BRAKE LEFT POSITION
description: Percent left brake

name: BRAKE LEFT POSITION EX1
description: Percent left brake, ignoring the effect of the parking brake.

name: BRAKE PARKING INDICATOR
description: Parking brake indicator

name: BRAKE PARKING POSITION
description: Gets the parking brake position - either on (true) or off (false).

name: BRAKE RIGHT POSITION
description: Percent right brake

name: BRAKE RIGHT POSITION EX1
description: Percent right brake, ignoring the effect of the parking brake.

name: REJECTED TAKEOFF BRAKES ACTIVE
description: Whether or not the rejected takeoff brakes are currently active.

name: TOE BRAKES AVAILABLE
description: True if toe brakes are available

name: CONTACT POINT COMPRESSION:index
description: The percentage value representing the amount the contact point is compressed. Index is from 0-19.

name: CONTACT POINT IS ON GROUND:index
description: Returns true if the indexed contact point is on the ground, or will return false otherwise. Index is from 0 - 19.

name: CONTACT POINT IS SKIDDING:index
description: Returns true if the indexed contact point is skidding, or will return false otherwise. Index is from 0 - 19.

name: CONTACT POINT POSITION:index
description: The currently extended position of the (retractable) contact point, expressed as a percentage. Index is from 0 - 19.

name: CONTACT POINT SKIDDING FACTOR:index
description: The skidding factor associated with the indexed contact point, from 0 to 1. Index is from 0 - 19.

name: CONTACT POINT WATER DEPTH:index
description: This returns the depth of the water for the indexed contact point. Index is from 0 - 19.

name: AUX WHEEL ROTATION ANGLE
description: Aux wheel rotation angle (rotation around the axis for the wheel).

name: AUX WHEEL RPM
description: Rpm of fourth set of gear wheels.

name: CENTER WHEEL ROTATION ANGLE
description:
Center wheel rotation angle (rotation around the axis for the wheel).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: CENTER WHEEL RPM
description: Center landing gear rpm.

name: GEAR ANIMATION POSITION:index
description:
Percent indexed gear animation extended. Index is one of the following:
          
0 = center
1 = left
2 = right
3 = aux

NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: GEAR AUX POSITION
description: Percent auxiliary gear extended.

name: GEAR AUX STEER ANGLE
description: Aux wheel angle, negative to the left, positive to the right. The aux wheel is the fourth set of landing gear, sometimes used on helicopters.

name: GEAR AUX STEER ANGLE PCT
description: Aux steer angle as a percentage.

name: GEAR CENTER POSITION
description: Percent center gear extended.

name: GEAR CENTER STEER ANGLE
description:
Center wheel angle, negative to the left, positive to the right.

name: GEAR CENTER STEER ANGLE PCT
description: Center steer angle as a percentage.

name: GEAR DAMAGE BY SPEED

name: GEAR EMERGENCY HANDLE POSITION
description: True if gear emergency handle applied.

name: GEAR HANDLE POSITION
description: The gear handle position, where 0 means the handle is retracted and 1 is the handle fully applied.

name: GEAR HYDRAULIC PRESSURE

name: GEAR IS SKIDDING:index
description: True if the gear is skidding.

name: GEAR LEFT POSITION

name: GEAR LEFT STEER ANGLE

Left wheel angle, negative to the left, positive to the right.

name: GEAR LEFT STEER ANGLE PCT
description: Left steer angle as a percentage.

name: GEAR POSITION:index

Position of landing gear.

name: GEAR RIGHT POSITION

name: GEAR RIGHT STEER ANGLE

Right wheel angle, negative to the left, positive to the right.

Alternative method of getting the steer angle. Index is one of the following:

0 = center
1 = left
2 = right

Alternative method of getting steer angle as a percentage. Index is one of the following:
          
0 = center

Percent tail gear extended.

Gear warnings. Index can be one of the following:

0 = unknown
1 = normal
2 = amphib
unit:
Enum:

0 = None
1 = Gear Up
2 = Amphibious Gear Up
3 = Amphibious Gear Down
4 = On Ground Handle Up

name: BLAST SHIELD POSITION:index
description: Indexed from 1, 100 is fully deployed, 0 flat on deck

name: CABLE CAUGHT BY TAILHOOK:index
description: A number 1 through 4 for the cable number caught by the tailhook. Cable 1 is the one closest to the stern of the carrier. A value of 0 indicates no cable was caught.

name: CATAPULT STROKE POSITION:index
description: Catapults are indexed from 1. This value will be 0 before the catapult fires, and then up to 100 as the aircraft is propelled down the catapult. The aircraft may takeoff before the value reaches 100 (depending on the aircraft weight, power applied, and other factors), in which case this value will not be further updated. This value could be used to drive a bogie animation.

name: HOLDBACK BAR INSTALLED
description: Holdback bars allow build up of thrust before takeoff from a catapult, and are installed by the deck crew of an aircraft carrier.

name: LAUNCHBAR HELD EXTENDED
description: This will be True if the launchbar is fully extended, and can be used, for example, to change the color of an instrument light.

name: LAUNCHBAR POSITION
description: Installed on aircraft before takeoff from a carrier catapult. Note that gear cannot retract with this extended. 100 = fully extended.

name: LAUNCHBAR SWITCH
description: If this is set to True the launch bar switch has been engaged.

name: NUMBER OF CATAPULTS
description: Maximum of 4. A model can contain more than 4 catapults, but only the first four will be read and recognized by the simulation.

name: CONCORDE NOSE ANGLE
description: The nose angle, where 0 is fully up.

name: CONCORDE VISOR NOSE HANDLE
description: The visor nose handle position.
unit:
Enum:

0:[index] visor up, nose down
1:[index] visor down, nose up
2:[index] visor down, nose 5 degrees
3:[index] visor down, nose 12.5 degrees

name: CONCORDE VISOR POSITION PERCENT
description: The visor position expressed as a percentage where 0.0 = up and 1.0 = extended/down.

name: BUS LOOKUP INDEX
description:
This is a settable simvar meaning that it can both be read and set. Some of the simvars in this list are using this to lookup a value using two arguments (one argument in addition to the component index). For example to check the state of the connection between a "circuit.45" and the "bus.2" it would be written as follows:
2 (>A:BUS LOOKUP INDEX, Number) (A:CIRCUIT CONNECTION ON:45, Bool)

name: BUS BREAKER PULLED
description: This will be true if the bus breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a bus index.

name: BUS CONNECTION ON
description: This will be true if the bus is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a bus index.

name: ELECTRICAL GENALT LOAD
description: This returns the percentage of the load output that is being consumed. This requires an alternator index when referencing.

name: ELECTRICAL GENALT BUS AMPS
description: The load handled by the alternator. This requires an alternator index when referencing.

name: ELECTRICAL GENALT BUS VOLTAGE
description: General alternator voltage. This requires an alternator index when referencing.

name: ELECTRICAL MAIN BUS VOLTAGE
description: The main bus voltage. Use a bus index when referencing.

name: ELECTRICAL AVIONICS BUS AMPS
description: Avionics bus current

name: ELECTRICAL AVIONICS BUS VOLTAGE
description: Avionics bus voltage

name: ELECTRICAL MAIN BUS AMPS
description: Main bus current

name: ELECTRICAL OLD CHARGING AMPS
description:
Deprecated, do not use!
Use ELECTRICAL BATTERY LOAD.

name: ELECTRICAL TOTAL LOAD AMPS
description: Total load amps

name: NEW ELECTRICAL SYSTEM
description: Is the aircraft using the new Electrical System or the legacy FSX one.

name: ALTERNATOR BREAKER PULLED
description: This will be true if the alternator breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and an alternator index.

name: ALTERNATOR CONNECTION ON
description: This will be true if the alternator is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and an alternator index.

name: GENERAL ENG MASTER ALTERNATOR:index
description: The alternator (generator) switch position, true if the switch is ON. Requires an engine index, and the use of an alternator index when referencing.

name: APU BLEED PRESSURE RECEIVED BY ENGINE
description: Bleed air pressure received by the engine from the APU.

name: APU GENERATOR ACTIVE:index
description: Set or get whether an APU is active (true) or not (false). Takes an index to be able to have multiple generators on a single APU.

name: APU GENERATOR SWITCH:index
description: Enables or disables the APU for an engine. Takes an index to be able to have multiple generators on a single APU

name: APU ON FIRE DETECTED
description: Will return true if the APU is on fire, or false otherwise.

name: APU PCT RPM
description: Auxiliary power unit RPM, as a percentage

name: APU PCT STARTER
description: Auxiliary power unit starter, as a percentage

name: APU SWITCH
description: Boolean, whether or not the APU is switched on.

name: APU VOLTS:index
description: The volts from the APU to the selected engine. Takes an index to be able to have multiple generators on a single APU.

name: BLEED AIR APU
description: Boolean, returns whether or not the APU attempts to provide Bleed Air.

name: BATTERY BREAKER PULLED
description: This will be true if the battery breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS LOOKUP INDEX and a battery index.

name: BATTERY CONNECTION ON
description: This will be true if the battery is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a battery index.

name: ELECTRICAL BATTERY BUS AMPS
description: Battery bus current

name: ELECTRICAL BATTERY BUS VOLTAGE
description: Battery bus voltage

name: ELECTRICAL BATTERY ESTIMATED CAPACITY PCT
description: Battery capacity over max capacity, 100 is full.

name: ELECTRICAL BATTERY LOAD
description: The load handled by the battery (negative values mean the battery is receiving current). Use a battery index when referencing.

name: ELECTRICAL BATTERY VOLTAGE
description: The battery voltage. Use a battery index when referencing.

name: ELECTRICAL HOT BATTERY BUS AMPS
description: Current available when battery switch is turned off

name: ELECTRICAL HOT BATTERY BUS VOLTAGE
description: Voltage available when battery switch is turned off

name: ELECTRICAL MASTER BATTERY
description: The battery switch position, true if the switch is ON. Use a battery index when referencing.

name: BREAKER ADF
description:
All these SimVars can be used to get or set the breaker state for the electrical system (either true or false).
If the breaker is popped (set to false), then the associated circuit will not receive electricity.

name: CIRCUIT AUTOPILOT ON
description: Is electrical power available to this circuit

name: CIRCUIT AUTO BRAKES ON
description: Is electrical power available to this circuit

name: CIRCUIT AUTO FEATHER ON
description: Is electrical power available to this circuit. Please see the Note On Autofeathering for more information.

name: CIRCUIT AVIONICS ON
description: Is electrical power available to this circuit

name: CIRCUIT BREAKER PULLED
description: This will be true if the circuit breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a circuit index.

name: CIRCUIT CONNECTION ON
description: This will be true if the circuit is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a circuit index.

name: CIRCUIT FLAP MOTOR ON
description: Is electrical power available to the flap motor circuit

name: CIRCUIT GEAR MOTOR ON
description: Is electrical power available to the gear motor circuit

name: CIRCUIT GEAR WARNING ON
description: Is electrical power available to gear warning circuit

name: CIRCUIT GENERAL PANEL ON
description: Is electrical power available to the general panel circuit

name: CIRCUIT HYDRAULIC PUMP ON
description: Is electrical power available to the hydraulic pump circuit

name: CIRCUIT MARKER BEACON ON
description: Is electrical power available to the marker beacon circuit

name: CIRCUIT NAVCOM1 ON
description: Whether or not power is available to the NAVCOM1 circuit.

name: CIRCUIT NAVCOM2 ON
description: Whether or not power is available to the NAVCOM2 circuit.

name: CIRCUIT NAVCOM3 ON
description: Whether or not power is available to the NAVCOM3 circuit.

name: CIRCUIT ON
description: This will be true if the given circuit is functioning. Use a circuit index when referencing.

name: CIRCUIT PITOT HEAT ON
description: Is electrical power available to the pitot heat circuit

name: CIRCUIT POWER SETTING
description: This returns the percentage of use that the circuit is getting. This requires a circuit index when referencing.

name: CIRCUIT PROP SYNC ON
description: Is electrical power available to the propeller sync circuit

name: CIRCUIT STANDBY VACUUM ON
description: Is electrical power available to the vacuum circuit

name: CIRCUIT SWITCH ON
description: The circuit switch position, true if the switch is ON. Use a circuit index when referencing.

name: EXTERNAL POWER AVAILABLE
description: This will be true if the given external power source is available. Use an external power index when referencing.

name: EXTERNAL POWER BREAKER PULLED
description: Boolean, The state of the breaker of an external power source

name: EXTERNAL POWER CONNECTION ON
description: Boolean, The state of the connection between a bus and an external power source

name: EXTERNAL POWER ON
description: The external power switch position, true if the switch is ON. Use an external power index when referencing.

name: BLEED AIR ENGINE:index
description: Returns whether or not the indexed engine (see note) attempts to provide bleed air.

name: BLEED AIR SOURCE CONTROL:index
description:
The bleed air system source controller for an indexed engine (see note). This will work as follows:

When engines and APU are activated, it will return 0 because it is in Auto.
If the APU is removed, it will return 3 for engines only.
If instead the engines are removed, it would return 2 for the APU only.
If the APU and engines are removed, it would return 1 (so, off).

name: COWL FLAPS
description: Deprecated, do not use!

name: ENGINE CONTROL SELECT
description: Selected engines (combination of bit flags)

name: ENGINE MIXURE AVAILABLE
description: True if engine mixture is available for prop engines. Deprecated, do not use (mixture is always available)!

name: ENGINE PRIMER
description: The engine primer position.

name: ENGINE TYPE
description: Engine type.
unit:
Enum:

0 = Piston
1 = Jet
2 = None
3 = Helo(Bell) turbine
4 = Unsupported
5 = Turboprop

name: ENG ANTI ICE:index
description: Anti-ice switch for the indexed engine (see note), true if enabled false otherwise.

name: ENG COMBUSTION:index
description: True if the indexed engine (see note) is running, false otherwise.

name: ENG CYLINDER HEAD TEMPERATURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) cylinder head temperature.

name: ENG EXHAUST GAS TEMPERATURE:index
description: Exhaust gas temperature for the indexed engine (see note).

name: ENG EXHAUST GAS TEMPERATURE GES:index
description: Governed engine setting exhaust gas temperature for the indexed engine (see note).

name: ENG FAILED:index
description: Failure flag for the indexed engine (see note) that has failed.

name: ENG FUEL FLOW BUG POSITION:index
description: Fuel flow reference in pounds per hour for the indexed engine (see note).

name: ENG FUEL FLOW GPH:index
description: Engine fuel flow in gallons per hour for the indexed engine (see note).

name: ENG FUEL FLOW PPH:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) fuel flow in pounds per hour.

name: ENG FUEL FLOW PPH SSL:index
description:
Engine fuel flow in pounds per hour.
Deprecated in favour of ENG FUEL FLOW PPH.

name: ENG HYDRAULIC PRESSURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) hydraulic pressure.

name: ENG HYDRAULIC QUANTITY:index
description: The indexed engine (see note)hydraulic fluid quantity, as a percentage of total capacity

name: ENG MANIFOLD PRESSURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) manifold pressure.

name: ENG MAX RPM
description: The indexed engine (see note) Maximum rpm.

name: ENG N1 RPM:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) N1 rpm.

name: ENG N2 RPM:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) N2 rpm.

name: ENG OIL PRESSURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) oil pressure.

name: ENG OIL QUANTITY:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) oil quantity as a percentage of full capacity.

name: ENG OIL TEMPERATURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) oil temperature.

name: ENG ON FIRE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) on fire state.

name: ENG PRESSURE RATIO:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) pressure ratio.

name: ENG PRESSURE RATIO GES:index
description: Engine pressure ratio. Deprecated, do not use!

name: ENG RPM ANIMATION PERCENT:index
description:
The indexed engine (see note) percentage maximum rated rpm - used for visual animation.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: ENG RPM SCALER:index
description: RPM scalar value. Deprecated, do not use!

name: ENG TORQUE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) torque.

name: ENG VIBRATION:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) vibration.

name: ESTIMATED FUEL FLOW:index
description: Estimated fuel flow to the indexed engine (see note) at cruise speed.

name: FULL THROTTLE THRUST TO WEIGHT RATIO
description: Full throttle thrust to weight ratio

name: GENERAL ENG ANTI ICE POSITION:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) anti-ice switch state - 0 (FALSE) is off and 1 (TRUE) is on.

name: GENERAL ENG COMBUSTION:index
description:
Set the indexed engine (see note) combustion flag to TRUE or FALSE. Note that this will not only stop all combustion, but it will also set the engine RPM to 0, regardless of the actual state of the simulation.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: GENERAL ENG COMBUSTION EX1:index
description: This SimVar is similar to GENERAL ENG COMBUSTION, in that it can also be used to enable or disable engine combustion. However this SimVar will not interfere with the current state of ths simulation. For example, if the aircraft has a turbine engine with auto_ignition enabled or it's a propeller engine with magnetos, then in the subsequent simulation frames this SimVar may be set to 1 (TRUE) again as the engine restarts automatically.

name: GENERAL ENG COMBUSTION SOUND PERCENT:index
description:
Percent of maximum sound being created by the indexed engine (see note).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: GENERAL ENG DAMAGE PERCENT:index
description: Percent of total damage to the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG ELAPSED TIME:index
description: Total elapsed time since the indexed engine (see note) was started.

name: GENERAL ENG EXHAUST GAS TEMPERATURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) exhaust gas temperature.

name: GENERAL ENG FAILED:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) fail flag.

name: GENERAL ENG FIRE DETECTED:index
description: Detects if a fire has been detected in an indexed engine (see note) or not. If 0 (FALSE) no fire has been detected and if 1 (TRUE) then it has.

name: GENERAL ENG FUEL PRESSURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) fuel pressure.

name: GENERAL ENG FUEL PUMP ON:index
description: Whether the indexed engine (see note) fuel pump on (1, TRUE) or off (0, FALSE).

name: GENERAL ENG FUEL PUMP SWITCH:index
description: Fuel pump switch state the indexed engine (see note). If 0 (FALSE) the pump is off and if 1 (TRUE) then it is on.

name: GENERAL ENG FUEL PUMP SWITCH EX1:index
description: Equivalent to GENERAL ENG FUEL PUMP SWITCH but differentiates between ON and AUTO

name: GENERAL ENG FUEL USED SINCE START:index
description: Fuel used since the indexed engine (see note) was last started.

name: GENERAL ENG FUEL VALVE:index
description: Fuel valve state for the indexed engine (see note). If 0 (FALSE) then the valve is closed and if 1 (TRUE) then it is open.

name: GENERAL ENG GENERATOR ACTIVE:index
description: Settable alternator (generator) on/off switch for the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG GENERATOR SWITCH:index
description: Alternator (generator) on/off switch state for the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG HOBBS ELAPSED TIME:index
description:
This can be used to find the time since the indexed engine (see note) started running. Similar to ElapsedTachometerTime, this records the time the engine has been running, but instead of taking a % of the time based on the Pct/RPM this takes the full time, but only if a threshold RPM/speed is reached. You can set the thresholds using the accumulated_time_hobbs_min_pct_rpm
          and accumulated_time_hobbs_min_knots parameters in the [GENERALENGINEDATA] section of the engines.cfg file.

name: GENERAL ENG MASTER ALTERNATOR
description: The alternator switch for a specific engine. Requires an engine index (1 - 4) when used.

name: GENERAL ENG MAX REACHED RPM:index
description: Maximum attained rpm for the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG MIXTURE LEVER POSITION:index
description: Percent of max mixture lever position for the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG OIL LEAKED PERCENT:index
description: Percent of max oil capacity leaked for the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG OIL PRESSURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) oil pressure.

name: GENERAL ENG OIL TEMPERATURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) oil temperature.

name: GENERAL ENG PCT MAX RPM:index
description:
Percent of max rated rpm for the indexed engine (see note).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: GENERAL ENG PROPELLER LEVER POSITION:index
description: Percent of max prop lever position for the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG REVERSE THRUST ENGAGED
description: This will return 1 (TRUE) if the reverse thruster is engaged, or 0 (FALSE) otherwise.

name: GENERAL ENG RPM:index
description:
The RPM for an indexed engine (see note).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: GENERAL ENG STARTER:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) starter on/off state.

name: GENERAL ENG STARTER ACTIVE:index
description:
True if the indexed engine (see note) starter is active.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: GENERAL ENG THROTTLE LEVER POSITION:index
description: Percent of max throttle position for the indexed engine (see note).

name: GENERAL ENG THROTTLE MANAGED MODE:index
description: Current mode of the managed throttle for the indexed engine (see note).

name: MASTER IGNITION SWITCH
description: Aircraft master ignition switch (grounds all engines magnetos).

name: MAX EGT
description: The maximum EGT, as set using the egt_peak_temperature parameter in the engines.cfg file.

name: MAX OIL TEMPERATURE
description: The maximum oil temperature, as set using the parameter oil_temp_heating_constant in the engines.cfg file.

name: MAX RATED ENGINE RPM
description: Maximum rated rpm for the indexed engine (see note).

name: NUMBER OF ENGINES
description: Number of engines (minimum 0, maximum 4)

name: OIL AMOUNT
description: Deprecated, do not use!

name: PANEL AUTO FEATHER SWITCH:index
description: Auto-feather arming switch for the indexed engine (see note). Please see the Note On Autofeathering for more information.

name: PROP AUTO CRUISE ACTIVE
description: True if prop auto cruise active

name: PROP AUTO FEATHER ARMED:index
description: Auto-feather armed state for the indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP BETA:index
description: The "prop beta" is the pitch of the blades of the propeller, and this can be used to retrieve the current pitch setting, per indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP BETA FORCED ACTIVE
description: This can be used to enable the propeller forced beta mode (1, TRUE) or disable it (0, FALSE), when being written to. When being read from, it will return TRUE (1) if the forced beta mode is enabled or FALSE (0) if it isn't. When enabled, the PROP BETA FORCED POSITION value will be used to drive the prop beta, while the internal coded simulation logic is used when this is disabled.

name: PROP BETA FORCED POSITION
description: Get or set the beta at which the prop is forced. Only valid when PROP BETA FORCED ACTIVE is TRUE (1).

name: PROP BETA MAX
description: The "prop beta" is the pitch of the blades of the propeller. This retrieves the maximum possible pitch value for all engines.

name: PROP BETA MIN
description: The "prop beta" is the pitch of the blades of the propeller. This retrieves the minimum possible pitch value for all engines.

name: PROP BETA MIN REVERSE
description: The "prop beta" is the pitch of the blades of the propeller. This retrieves the minimum possible pitch value when the propeller is in reverse for all engines.

name: PROP DEICE SWITCH:index
description: True if prop deice switch on for the indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP FEATHERED:index
description: This will return the feathered state of the propeller for an indexed engine (see note). The state is either feathered (true) or not (false).

name: PROP FEATHERING INHIBIT:index
description: Feathering inhibit flag for the indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP FEATHER SWITCH:index
description: Prop feather switch for the indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP MAX RPM PERCENT:index
description:
Percent of max rated rpm for the indexed engine (see note).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: PROP ROTATION ANGLE
description:
Prop rotation angle.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: PROP RPM:index
description: Propeller rpm for the indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP SYNC ACTIVE:index
description: True if prop sync is active the indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP SYNC DELTA LEVER:index
description: Corrected prop correction input on slaved engine for the indexed engine (see note).

name: PROP THRUST:index
description:
Propeller thrust for the indexed engine (see note).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: PROPELLER ADVANCED SELECTION
description: Deprecated, do not use!

name: SHUTOFF VALVE PULLED
description: This checks if the shutoff valve to the engine has been pulled (true) or not (false). When pulled piston engines will be blocked from getting any fuel.

name: THROTTLE LOWER LIMIT
description: Percent throttle defining lower limit (negative for reverse thrust equipped airplanes).

name: TURB ENG AFTERBURNER:index
description:
Afterburner state for the indexed engine (see note).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: TURB ENG AFTERBURNER PCT ACTIVE:index
description:
The percentage that the afterburner is running at.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: TURB ENG AFTERBURNER STAGE ACTIVE:index
description:
The stage of the afterburner, or 0 if the afterburner is not active.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all near aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: TURB ENG BLEED AIR:index
description: Bleed air pressure for the indexed engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG COMMANDED N1:index
description: Effective commanded N1 for the indexed turbine engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG CONDITION LEVER POSITION:index
description:
When the throttle is on idle position, this sets the condition levers to one of 3 positions to define the idle N1 target for the indexed engine (see note):

Down position is the cut-off position that cuts the fuel to the engine, effectively shutting down the engine.
Middle position requires N1 to reach the low idle value when throttle is in idle position (low idle value can be checked using the TURB_ENG_LOW_IDLE SimVar).
High position requires N1 to reach the high idle value when throttle is in idle position (high idle value can be checked using the TURB_ENG_HIGH_IDLE SimVar).

Note that this option requires several settings from the engines.cfg file to be set to specific values before working correctly:

DisableMixtureControls needs to be set to 1 (TRUE).
tp_idle_range should be set to 0 (since there is no mixture setting).
idle_fuel_flow and idle_high_fuel_flow must be set to the same value (since there is no mixture setting to induce a variation between the 2).
low_idle_n1 and high_idle_n1 to be correctly set.
unit:
Enum:

0 = fuel cut-off
1 = low idle
2 = high idle

name: TURB ENG CORRECTED FF:index
description: Corrected fuel flow for the indexed engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG CORRECTED N1:index
description: The indexed turbine engine (see note) corrected N1.

name: TURB ENG CORRECTED N2:index
description: The indexed turbine engine (see note) corrected N2.

name: TURB ENG FREE TURBINE TORQUE:index
description: The amount of free torque for the indexed turbine engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG FUEL AVAILABLE:index
description: True if fuel is available for the indexed engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG FUEL EFFICIENCY LOSS:index
description: This is used to control the fuel efficiency loss of the indexed engine, from 0 - no fuel efficiency loss - to 100 - double the fuel consumption.

name: TURB ENG FUEL FLOW PPH:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) fuel flow rate.

name: TURB ENG HIGH IDLE:index
description: Retrieves the high idle N1 value to be reached by the the indexed turboprop engine (see note) with throttle in idle position and condition lever in high idle position (condition lever position can be checked or set using the TURB_ENG_CONDITION_LEVER_POSITION SimVar).

name: TURB ENG IGNITION SWITCH:index
description: True if the the indexed turbine engine (see note) ignition switch is on.

name: TURB ENG IGNITION SWITCH EX1:index
description: Position of the the indexed turbine engine (see note) Ignition Switch. Similar to TURB_ENG_IGNITION_SWITCH but differentiates between ON and AUTO.

name: TURB ENG IS IGNITING:index
description: Whether or not the ignition system is currently running for the indexed engine (see note). Depends on TURB_ENG_IGNITION_SWITCH_EX1 Enum, the cfg var ignition_auto_type and current state of the plane.

name: TURB ENG ITT:index
description: Retrieve or set the ITT for the indexed engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG ITT COOLING EFFICIENCY LOSS:index
description: This is used to control the ITT cooling efficiency loss of the indexed engine, from 0 - no cooling efficiency loss - to 100 -engine recieves no ITT cooling.

name: TURB ENG JET THRUST:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) jet thrust.

name: TURB ENG LOW IDLE:index
description: Retrieves the low idle N1 value to be reached by the the indexed turboprop engine (see note) with throttle in idle position and condition lever in low idle position (condition lever position can be checked or set using the TURB_ENG_CONDITION_LEVER_POSITION SimVar).

name: TURB ENG MASTER STARTER SWITCH
description: True if the turbine engine master starter switch is on, false otherwise.

name: TURB ENG MAX TORQUE PERCENT:index
description: Percent of max rated torque for the indexed engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG N1:index
description:
The indexed turbine engine (see note) N1 value.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: TURB ENG N1 LOSS:index
description: This is used to control the N1 loss of the indexed engine, from 0 - no N1 loss - to 100 - 100% N1 loss.

name: TURB ENG N2:index
description:
The indexed turbine engine (see note) N2 value.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: TURB ENG NUM TANKS USED:index
description: Number of tanks currently being used by the indexed engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG PRESSURE RATIO:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) pressure ratio.

name: TURB ENG PRIMARY NOZZLE PERCENT:index
description: Percent thrust of primary nozzle for the indexed engine (see note).

name: TURB ENG REVERSE NOZZLE PERCENT:index
description:
Percent thrust reverser nozzles deployed for the indexed engine (see note).
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: TURB ENG TANKS USED:index
description:
Fuel tanks used by the indexed engine (see note), one or more of the following bit flags:
          
Center 1 Bit 0
Center 2 Bit 1
Center 3 Bit 2
Left Main Bit 3
Left Aux Bit 4
Left Tip Bit 5
Right Main Bit 6
Right Aux Bit 7
Right Tip Bit 8
External 1 Bit 9
External 2 Bit 10

name: TURB ENG TANK SELECTOR:index
description: Fuel tank selected for the indexed engine (see note). See Fuel Tank Selection for a list of values.

name: TURB ENG THROTTLE COMMANDED N1:index
description: The indexed turbine engine (see note) commanded N1 for current throttle position.

name: TURB ENG THRUST EFFICIENCY LOSS:index
description: This can be used to control the thrust efficiency loss of the indexed engine, where a value of 0 is 100% of available thrust, and 100 is 0% available thrust.

name: TURB ENG VIBRATION:index
description: The indexed turbine engine (see note) vibration value.

name: TURB MAX ITT
description: Retrieve the itt_peak_temperature as set in the engines.cfg file.

name: RECIP CARBURETOR TEMPERATURE:index
description: Carburetor temperature the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG ALTERNATE AIR POSITION:index
description: Alternate air control the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG ANTIDETONATION TANK MAX QUANTITY:index
description: The maximum quantity of water/methanol mixture in the ADI tank for the indexed engine (see note). This value is set as part of the [ANTIDETONATION_SYSTEM.N] section in the aircraft configuration files.

name: RECIP ENG ANTIDETONATION TANK QUANTITY:index
description: The quantity of water/methanol mixture currently in the ADI tank for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG ANTIDETONATION TANK VALVE:index
description: The status of the ADI tank valve for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG ANTIDETONATION FLOW RATE:index
description: This gives the actual flow rate of the Anti Detonation system for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG BRAKE POWER:index
description: Brake power produced by the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG COOLANT RESERVOIR PERCENT:index
description: Percent coolant available for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG COWL FLAP POSITION:index
description: Percent cowl flap opened for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG CYLINDER HEAD TEMPERATURE:index
description: Engine cylinder head temperature for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG CYLINDER HEALTH:index
description: Index high 16 bits is engine number, low16 cylinder number, both indexed from 1.

name: RECIP ENG DETONATING:index
description: Set to 1 (TRUE) if the indexed engine (see note) is detonating.

name: RECIP ENG EMERGENCY BOOST ACTIVE:index
description: Whether emergency boost is active (1, TRUE) or not (0, FALSE) for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG EMERGENCY BOOST ELAPSED TIME:index
description:
The elapsed time that emergency boost has been active on the indexed engine (see note). The timer will start when boost is first activated.
IMPORTANT! This timer does not reset. So if you set your time limit in the engines.cfg file to 315s and you spend 2 minutes with boost active, then pull back on the throttle for 1 minute, then engage boost again for 2 minutes, the simulation will consider that you spent 4 minutes with boost active. The 1 minute pause is not taken into account.

name: RECIP ENG ENGINE MASTER SWITCH:index
description: Whether or not the Engine Master switch is active on an indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG FUEL AVAILABLE:index
description: True if fuel is available for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG FUEL FLOW:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) fuel flow.

name: RECIP ENG FUEL NUMBER TANKS USED:index
description: Number of tanks currently being used by the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG FUEL TANKS USED:index
description:
Fuel tanks used by the indexed engine (see note), one or more of the following bit flags:
          
Center 1 Bit 0
Center 2 Bit 1
Center 3 Bit 2
Left Main Bit 3
Left Aux Bit 4
Left Tip Bit 5
Right Main Bit 6
Right Aux Bit 7
Right Tip Bit 8
External 1 Bit 9
External 2 Bit 10

name: RECIP ENG FUEL TANK SELECTOR:index
description: Fuel tank selected for the indexed engine (see note). See Fuel Tank Selection for a list of values.

name: RECIP ENG GLOW PLUG ACTIVE:index
description: Whether or not the Glow Plug is active on the indexed engine (see note)..

name: RECIP ENG LEFT MAGNETO:index
description: Left magneto state for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG MANIFOLD PRESSURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) manifold pressure.

name: RECIP ENG NITROUS TANK MAX QUANTITY:index
description: The maximum quantity of nitrous permitted per indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG NITROUS TANK QUANTITY:index
description: The quantity of nitrous per indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG NITROUS TANK VALVE
description: The statte of the nitrous tank valve for the indexed engine (see note). Either 1 (TRUE) for open or 0 (FALSE) for closed.

name: RECIP ENG NUM CYLINDERS:index
description: The number of cylinders for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG NUM CYLINDERS FAILED:index
description: The number of cylinders that have failed in the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG PRIMER:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) primer state.

name: RECIP ENG RADIATOR TEMPERATURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) radiator temperature.

name: RECIP ENG RIGHT MAGNETO:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) right magneto state.

name: RECIP ENG STARTER TORQUE:index
description: Torque produced by the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG SUPERCHARGER ACTIVE GEAR:index
description: Returns which of the supercharger gears is engaged for the indexed engine (see note).

name: RECIP ENG TURBINE INLET TEMPERATURE:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) turbine inlet temperature.

name: RECIP ENG TURBOCHARGER FAILED:index
description: The indexed engine (see note) turbo failed state.

name: RECIP ENG WASTEGATE POSITION:index
description: When the engines.cfg parameter turbocharged is TRUE, this SimVar will return the percentage that the turbo waste gate is closed for the indexed engine (see note). If the turbocharged variable is FALSE and the manifold_pressure_regulator parameter is TRUE, then this will return the percentage that the manifold pressure regulator is closed for the indexed engine.

name: RECIP MAX CHT
description: This will return the cylinder head temperature value set by the cht_heating_constant parameter in the engines.cfg file.

name: RECIP MIXTURE RATIO:index
description: Fuel / Air mixture ratio for the indexed engine (see note).

name: BETA DOT
description: Beta dot

name: DECISION ALTITUDE MSL
description: Design decision altitude above mean sea level

name: DECISION HEIGHT
description: Design decision height

name: DESIGN CRUISE ALT
description: This design constant represents the optimal altitude the aircraft should maintain when in cruise. It is derived from the cruise_alt setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default is 1500ft.

name: DESIGN SPAWN ALTITUDE CRUISE
description: This design constant represents the spawn altitude for the aircraft when spawning in cruise. It is derived from the spawn_cruise_altitude setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default is 1500ft.

name: DESIGN SPAWN ALTITUDE DESCENT
description: This design constant represents the spawn altitude for the aircraft when spawning in descent. It is derived from the spawn_descent_altitude setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default is 500ft.

name: DESIGN SPEED CLIMB
description: This design constant represents the optimal climb speed for the aircraft. It is derived from the climb_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is -1.

name: DESIGN SPEED MIN ROTATION
description: This design constant represents the minimum speed required for aircraft rotation. It is derived from the rotation_speed_min setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is -1.

name: DESIGN SPEED VC
description: This design constant represents the aircraft ideal cruising speed. It is derived from the cruise_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. The default value is computed an internal function that uses the estimated cruise altitude and estimated cruise percent power, according of the engine type, the number of engines, the density, the wing area and some drag parameters. Normally this value is set in the CFG file and the default value is never used.

name: DESIGN SPEED VS0
description: This design constant represents the the stall speed when flaps are fully extended. It is derived from the full_flaps_stall_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is 0.8 x VS.

name: DESIGN SPEED VS1
description: This design constant represents the stall speed when flaps are fully retracted. It is derived from the flaps_up_stall_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is 0.

name: DESIGN TAKEOFF SPEED
description: This design constant represents the aircraft ideal takoff speed. It is derived from the takeoff_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg.

name: DYNAMIC PRESSURE
description: Dynamic pressure

name: ESTIMATED CRUISE SPEED
description: Estimated cruise speed

name: G FORCE
description: Current g force

name: G LIMITER SETTING
description: This returns the setting of the G-limiter, as set using the GLimiterSetting parameter.

name: INCIDENCE ALPHA

name: INCIDENCE BETA

name: IS TAIL DRAGGER

name: LINEAR CL ALPHA

name: MIN G FORCE

name: SEMIBODY LOADFACTOR Y

name: SEMIBODY LOADFACTOR YDOT

name: SEMIBODY LOADFACTOR Z

name: SIGMA SQRT

name: SIMULATED RADIUS

name: STALL ALPHA
description: The angle of attack which produces the maximum lift coefficient before entering into stall conditions.

name: STATIC PITCH
description: The angle at which static pitch stability is achieved.

name: TYPICAL DESCENT RATE
description: the typical (normal) descent rate for the aircraft.

name: WING AREA

name: WING FLEX PCT:index
description: The current wing flex. Different values can be set for each wing (for example, during banking). Set an index of 1 for the left wing, and 2 for the right wing.

name: WING SPAN

name: YAW STRING ANGLE
description: The yaw string angle. Yaw strings are attached to gliders as visible indicators of the yaw angle. An animation of this is not implemented in ESP.

name: YAW STRING PCT EXTENDED
description: Yaw string angle as a percentage

name: ZERO LIFT ALPHA
description: The angle of attack at which the wing has zero lift.

name: CG AFT LIMIT
description:
Most backward authorized position of the CG according to the POH.
NOTE: This is only valid for airplanes.

name: CG FEET
description:
The longitudinal CG position relative to the Reference Datum Position.
NOTE: This is only valid for helicopters.

name: CG FEET AFT LIMIT

The aft CG limit position relative to the Reference Datum Position.
NOTE: This is only valid for helicopters.

name: CG FEET LATERAL
description:
The lateral CG position relative to the Reference Datum Position.
NOTE: This is only valid for helicopters.

name: CG FEET LATERAL LEFT LIMIT
description:
The left hand lateral CG position relative to the Reference Datum Position.
NOTE: This is only valid for helicopters.

name: CG FEET LATERAL RIGHT LIMIT
description:
The right hand lateral CG position relative to the Reference Datum Position.
NOTE: This is only valid for helicopters.

name: CG FEET FWD LIMIT
description:
The forward CG limit position relative to the Reference Datum Position.
NOTE: This is only valid for helicopters.

name: CG FWD LIMIT

Most forward authorized position of the CG according to the POH.
NOTE: This is only valid for airplanes.

name: CG MIN MACH

name: CG PERCENT

Longitudinal CG position as a percent of reference Chord.
NOTE: This is only valid for airplanes.

name: CG PERCENT LATERAL

Lateral CG position as a percent of reference Chord.
NOTE: This is only valid for airplanes.

name: STATIC CG TO GROUND
description:
Static CG position with reference to the ground.
NOTE: This is only valid for airplanes.

name: INTERACTIVE POINT HEADING
description: Interactive Point orientation: Heading

name: INTERACTIVE POINT JETWAY RIGHT DEPLOYMENT

name: INTERACTIVE POINT JETWAY TOP VERTICAL

name: INTERACTIVE POINT OPEN

name: INTERACTIVE POINT PITCH

description: Interactive Point X position relative to datum reference point

name: INTERACTIVE POINT POSY

name: FUEL CROSS FEED:index
description: Cross feed valve setting. This will return the current setting for the fuel crossfeed for the indexed engine, based on the current status of the simulation and the Cross Feed key events.
unit:
Enum:

0 = Closed
1 = Open
2 = Left to Right
3 = Right to Left

name: FUEL DUMP ACTIVE
description: If 1 (TRUE) then the aircraft can dump fuel.

name: FUEL DUMP SWITCH
description: If set to 1 (TRUE) then the aircraft will dump fuel at the rate set by fuel_dump_rate parameter in the flight_model.cfg file.

name: FUEL LEFT CAPACITY
description: Maximum capacity in volume of all the tanks on the left side of the aircraft.

name: FUEL LEFT QUANTITY
description: Current quantity in volume of all the tanks on the left side of the aircraft.

name: FUEL PUMP
description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: FUEL RIGHT CAPACITY
description: Maximum capacity in volume of all the tanks on the right side of the aircraft.

name: FUEL RIGHT QUANTITY
description: Current quantity in volume of all the tanks on the right side of the aircraft.

name: FUEL SELECTED QUANTITY:index
description: Quantity of fuel in the tank referenced by the indexed selector. When using the legacy fuel system, this SimVar will return the quantity of fuel in the tank pointed to by the selector you chose with the index. If passing an index higher than the number of selectors - or when using the modern fuel system - it will return the total fuel quantity available.

name: FUEL SELECTED QUANTITY PERCENT:index
description: Percent or capacity for the tank referenced by the indexed selector. When using the legacy fuel system, this SimVar will return the percentage of fuel in the tank pointed to by the selector you chose with the index. If passing an index higher than the number of selectors available - or when using the modern fuel system - it will return the percentage of total fuel quantity available.

name: FUEL SELECTED TRANSFER MODE
description:
The method of transfer for the fuel. Each of the available transfer options are explained below:

off - Fuel transfer is switched off.
auto - Automatically balance the fuel between the Center1 and Center2 tanks to maintain the center of gravity.
forward - Fuel will be transferred forwards from the Center1 tank to the Center2 tank.
aft - Fuel will be transferred aftwards from the Center2 tank to the Center1 tank.
manual - Fuel will be transferred for 1 second from the Center1 tank to the Center2 tank at a rate of 1lbs/s.
custom - This requires one or more pumps to have been defined using the fuel_transfer_pump.N parameter in the flight_model.cfg file, as well as their associated electrical circuits.
unit:
Enum:

0 = off
1 = auto
2 = forward
3 = aft
4 = manual
5 = custom

description: Total fuel capacity of the aircraft for all tanks.

name: FUEL TOTAL QUANTITY
description: Current total quantity of fuel in volume for all tanks of the aircraft.

name: FUEL TOTAL QUANTITY WEIGHT
description: Current total fuel weight for all tanks of the aircraft

description: Returns 1 (TRUE) if the indexed pump is active.

name: FUEL WEIGHT PER GALLON
description: The weight of the fuel, per gallon.

name: NEW FUEL SYSTEM
description: Will return 1 (TRUE) if the aircraft is using the modern [FUEL_SYSTEM] or 0 (FALSE) for the legacy [FUEL].

name: NUM FUEL SELECTORS
description: The number of fuel selectors on the aircraft.

name: UNLIMITED FUEL
description: Will return 1 (TRUE) if the unlimited fuel flag has been enabled, or 0 (FALSE) otherwise.

name: UNUSABLE FUEL TOTAL QUANTITY
description: The total amount of fuel in all tanks of the aircraft which is not usable.

name: FUELSYSTEM ENGINE PRESSURE:index
description: The pressure of the fuel coming to the indexed engine. The index is the number of the engine N component as defined by the Engine.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM JUNCTION SETTING:index
description: This will return the current Option for the indexed junction. The index is the number of the line N component as defined by the Junction.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM LINE FUEL FLOW:index
description: The fuel flowing through the indexed line in Gallons per Hour. The index is the number of the line N component as defined by the Line.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM LINE FUEL LEVEL:index
description: The level of fuel in the indexed line in Gallons. The index is the number of the line N component as defined by the Line.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM LINE FUEL PRESSURE:index
description: The pressure in the indexed fuel line, measured in KiloPascal. The index is the number of the line N component as defined by the Line.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM PUMP ACTIVE:index
description: Whether or not the indexed pump is actually active. The index is the number of the pump N component as defined by the Pump.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM PUMP SWITCH:index
description: Whether or not the indexed pump is enabled. The index is the number of the pump N component as defined by the Pump.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM TANK CAPACITY:index
description:
Total capacity of the indexed fuel tank. The index is the number of the tank N component as defined by the Tank.N parameter.
NOTE: This SimVar can only be used with the modern Fuel System.

name: FUELSYSTEM TANK LEVEL:index
description:
Quantity of fuel available in the indexed fuel tank. The index is the number of the tank N component as defined by the Tank.N parameter.
NOTE: This SimVar can only be used with the modern Fuel System.

name: FUELSYSTEM TANK QUANTITY:index
description:
Quantity of fuel currently available in the indexed fuel tank. The index is the number of the tank N component as defined by the Tank.N parameter.
NOTE: If the fuel system Version is 2 or below, the index value will be one of the Fuel Tank Selection indices.

name: FUELSYSTEM TANK TOTAL QUANTITY:index
description:
Total quantity of fuel available in the indexed fuel tank, including any unusable fuel. The index is the number of the tank N component as defined by the Tank.N parameter.
NOTE: If the fuel system Version is 2 or below, the index value will be one of the Fuel Tank Selection indices.

name: FUELSYSTEM TANK WEIGHT:index
description:
Weight of fuel available in the indexed fuel tank. The index is the number of the tank N component as defined by the Tank.N parameter.
NOTE: If the fuel system Version is 2 or below, the index value will be one of the Fuel Tank Selection indices.

name: FUELSYSTEM TRIGGER STATUS:index
description: Whether or not the indexed trigger is active. The index is the number of the trigger N component as defined by the Trigger.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM VALVE OPEN:index
description: Whether or not the indexed valve is actually fully opened. The index is the number of the valve N component as defined by the Valve.N parameter.

name: FUELSYSTEM VALVE SWITCH:index
description: Whether or not the indexed valve is set to be opened. The index is the number of the valve N component as defined by the Valve.N parameter.

name: SURFACE RELATIVE GROUND SPEED
description: The speed of the aircraft relative to the speed of the first surface directly underneath it. Use this to retrieve, for example, an aircraft's taxiing speed while it is moving on a moving carrier. It also applies to airborne aircraft, for example when a helicopter is successfully hovering above a moving ship, this value should be zero. The returned value will be the same as GROUND VELOCITY if the first surface beneath it is not moving.

Speed relative to the earths surface.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: PLANE TOUCHDOWN HEADING DEGREES MAGNETIC

name: PLANE TOUCHDOWN HEADING DEGREES TRUE

name: PLANE TOUCHDOWN LONGITUDE

name: PLANE TOUCHDOWN NORMAL VELOCITY
description: This float represents the player's plane speed according to ground normal from the last touchdown.

name: PLANE TOUCHDOWN PITCH DEGREES
description: This float represents the pitch of the player's plane from the last touchdown.

name: RELATIVE WIND VELOCITY BODY X

name: RELATIVE WIND VELOCITY BODY Y
description: Vertical (Y axis) speed relative to wind.

name: ROTATION ACCELERATION BODY Z

name: ROTATION VELOCITY BODY Y

name: ROTATION VELOCITY BODY Z

name: VELOCITY BODY Y
description: True vertical speed, relative to aircraft Y axis.

name: VELOCITY BODY Z

name: VERTICAL SPEED

name: EYEPOINT POSITION

name: STRUC AIRSPEED HOLD PID CONSTS
description: Returns the various airspeed PID constants. This is generally only used for AI controlled aircraft and boats, although it may be useful when working with RTCs and the user aircraft.

name: STRUC HEADING HOLD PID CONSTS
description: Returns the various airspeed PID constants. This is generally only used for AI controlled aircraft and boats, although it may be useful when working with RTCs and the user aircraft.

name: STRUCT BODY ROTATION VELOCITY

name: STRUCT BODY VELOCITY
description: The object body velocity.

name: STRUCT ENGINE POSITION:index
description: The position of the indexed engine relative to the Datum Reference Point for the aircraft.

name: STRUCT EYEPOINT DYNAMIC ANGLE
description: The angle of the eyepoint view. Zero, zero, zero is straight ahead.

name: STRUCT EYEPOINT DYNAMIC OFFSET
description: A variable offset away from the EYEPOINT POSITION.

name: STRUCT LATLONALT
description: Returns the latitude, longitude and altitude of the user aircraft.

name: STRUCT LATLONALTPBH

name: AIRCRAFT WIND X

name: AIRCRAFT WIND Y

name: AIRCRAFT WIND Z

name: AIRSPEED BARBER POLE

name: AIRSPEED INDICATED
description: Indicated airspeed.

name: AIRSPEED MACH

name: AIRSPEED SELECT INDICATED OR TRUE

name: AIRSPEED TRUE

name: BARBER POLE MACH

name: TOTAL VELOCITY
description: Velocity regardless of direction. For example, if a helicopter is ascending vertically at 100 fps, getting this variable will return 100.

name: WINDSHIELD WIND VELOCITY
description: Longitudinal speed of wind on the windshield.

name: STANDARD ATM TEMPERATURE
description: Outside temperature on the standard ATM scale.

name: TOTAL AIR TEMPERATURE
description: Total air temperature is the air temperature at the front of the aircraft where the ram pressure from the speed of the aircraft is taken into account.

name: ATC AIRLINE

name: ATC AIRPORT IS TOWERED
description: If the airport is controlled, this boolean is true.

description: Returns whether or not the user has filed an IFR flightplan that has been cleared by the sim ATC

name: ATC CLEARED LANDING
description: Whether the ATC has cleared the plane for landing.

name: ATC CLEARED TAKEOFF
description: Whether the ATC has cleared the plane for takeoff.

name: ATC CLEARED TAXI
description: Whether the ATC has cleared the plane for taxi.

description: Returns the target altitude for the current ATC flightplan waypoint.

name: ATC FLIGHT NUMBER
description: Flight Number used by ATC, as a string with a maximum number of 6 characters.

name: ATC FLIGHTPLAN DIFF ALT
description: Altitude between the position of the aircraft and his closest waypoints in the flightplan.

name: ATC FLIGHTPLAN DIFF DISTANCE
description: Returns the lateral distance the user's plane is from the ATC flight plan track.

name: ATC FLIGHTPLAN DIFF HEADING
description: Heading between the position of the aircraft and his closest waypoints in the flightplan.

name: ATC HEAVY
description: Is this aircraft recognized by ATC as heavy.

name: ATC ID
description: ID used by ATC, as a string with a maximum number of 10 characters.

name: ATC IFR FP TO REQUEST
description: Returns true if the user has a valid IFR flight plan they can as for clearance for with ATC at the airport they are currently at.

name: ATC MODEL
description: Model used by ATC, as a string with a maximum number of 10 characters.

name: ATC ON PARKING SPOT
description: Is ATC aircraft on parking spot.

name: ATC PREVIOUS WAYPOINT ALTITUDE
description: Returns the target altitude for the previous ATC flightplan waypoint.

name: ATC RUNWAY AIRPORT NAME
description: The name of the airport of the runway assigned by the ATC. Returns "" if no runway is assigned.

name: ATC RUNWAY DISTANCE
description: This float represents the distance between the player's plane and the center of the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY END DISTANCE
description: This is a float corresponding to the horizontal distance between the player's plane and the end of the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY HEADING DEGREES TRUE
description: This float represents the true heading of the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY LENGTH
description: The length of the runway assigned by the ATC. Returns -1 if no runway is assigned.

name: ATC RUNWAY RELATIVE POSITION X
description: This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative X (transverse) position on the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY RELATIVE POSITION Y
description: This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative Y (height) position on the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY RELATIVE POSITION Z
description: This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative Z (longitudinal) position on the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY SELECTED
description: This is a boolean corresponding to whether or not the ATC has pre-selected a runway for the player's plane. If this is false, every other ATC RUNWAY * SimVar will return default values.

name: ATC RUNWAY START DISTANCE
description: This is a float corresponding to the horizontal distance between the player's plane and the start of the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY TDPOINT RELATIVE POSITION X
description: This float represents the player's main gear relative X (transverse) position according to the aiming point of the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY TDPOINT RELATIVE POSITION Y
description: This float represents the player's main gear relative Y (height) position according to the aiming point of the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY TDPOINT RELATIVE POSITION Z
description: This float represents the player's main relative Z (longitudinal) position according to the aiming point of the runway selected by the ATC.

name: ATC RUNWAY WIDTH
description: The width of the runway assigned by the ATC. Returns -1 if no runway is assigned.

name: ATC SUGGESTED MIN RWY LANDING
description: Suggested minimum runway length for landing. Used by ATC.

name: ATC SUGGESTED MIN RWY TAKEOFF
description: Suggested minimum runway length for takeoff. Used by ATC.

name: ATC TAXIPATH DISTANCE
description: Returns the lateral distance the user's plane is from the path of the currently issued ATC taxi instructions.

name: ATC TYPE
description: Type used by ATC.

name: COM ACTIVE LATLONALT:index
description:
This will return the latitude, longitude and altitude corresponding to the indexed COM station associated with the active COM frequency. If the station is not associated with an airport, then the lat/lon/alt values returned will be -15943°, 80°, -10000 (this means that you can simply check that the altitude value is greater than 0 to assure the validity of the returned struct).
Index is 1, 2 or 3.

name: COM LATLONALT:index

name: FLARM AVAILABLE
description: Whether the FLARM is available (TRUE, 1) or not (FALSE, 0).

name: FLARM THREAT BEARING
description: The bearing of the FLARM threat aircraft, relative to track.

name: FLARM THREAT DATA
description:
The FLARM threat aircraft data structure, which contains data about the perceived threat, returned as a struct. Struct member variables are as follows:

id (U62): the network id of the intruding plane so that they are remembered in order to compute their trajectory.
bearing (FLOAT64): The threat bearing, in degrees (this is bearing from track axis and not bearing from the airplane axis).
heading (FLOAT64): The threat heading.
distance (FLOAT64): The distance between the aircraft and the threat, in meters.
verticalBearing (FLOAT64): The vertical bearing between the aircraft and the threat, in degrees.
relativeAltitude (FLOAT64): The relative altitude of the threat to the aircraft, in meters.
timeToCollision (FLOAT64): The estimated time to a collision, in seconds.

name: FLARM THREAT DISTANCE
description: The distance to the FLARM threat object.

name: FLARM THREAT HEADING
description: The heading to the FLARM threat object.

name: FLARM THREAT RELATIVE ALTITUDE
description: The relative altitude of the threat object.

name: FLARM THREAT TIME TO COLLISION
description: The estimated time to a collision.

name: FLARM THREAT VERTICAL BEARING
description: The vertical bearing towards the threat.

name: GPS CDI NEEDLE
description: The course deviation of the needle for a CDI instrument. The SimVar displays the deviation from -127 to +127. It returns a value if a flight plan is set (otherwise it will return 0) even if the autopilot isn't on GPS mode. Scaling can also be set through the GPS CDI SCALING simvar.

name: NAV GLIDE SLOPE
description:
The glide slope gradient. The value returned is an integer value formed as follows:
sin(slope) * 65536 * 2
So, for example, a glide slope of 2.7º would return a value of 6174. TO get the value in degrees, then use NAV_RAW_GLIDE_SLOPE instead.

name: NAV GLIDE SLOPE ERROR
description: Difference between current position and glideslope angle. Note that this provides 32 bit floating point precision, rather than the 8 bit integer precision of NAV GSI.

name: NAV GLIDE SLOPE LENGTH
description: The distance between the plane and the Glide beacon.

name: NAV GSI
description: Glideslope needle deflection (+/- 119). Note that this provides only 8 bit precision, whereas NAV GLIDE SLOPE ERROR provides 32 bit floating point precision.

name: NAV GS FLAG
description: Glideslope flag.

name: NAV GS LATLONALT:index

String
          
'L' - Left
'R' - Right
'C' - Center
'W' - Water
'A' - A
'B' - B

name: NAV LOC RUNWAY NUMBER
description: NAV LOC RUNWAY NUMBER - The number portion of the runway that the currently tuned localizer is tuned to (so if the runway was 15L, this would be 15).

name: NAV NAME
description: Descriptive name.

name: NAV OBS

name: NAV RADIAL
description: Radial that aircraft is on.

name: NAV RADIAL ERROR
description: Difference between current radial and OBS tuned radial.

name: NAV RAW GLIDE SLOPE
description: The glide slope angle.

name: NAV RELATIVE BEARING TO STATION
description: Relative bearing to station.

name: NAV SIGNAL
description: Nav signal strength.

name: NAV SOUND:index
description: Nav audio flag. Index of 1 or 2.

name: NAV STANDBY FREQUENCY:index
description: Nav standby frequency. Index is 1 or 2.

name: NAV TOFROM
description: Returns whether the Nav is going to or from the current radial (or is off).

name: NAV VOLUME
description: The volume of the Nav radio.

name: NAV VOR DISTANCE
description: Distance of the VOR beacon.

name: NAV VOR LATLONALT:index
description: Returns the VOR station latitude, longitude and altitude.

name: NAV VOR LLAF64
description: Nav VOR latitude, longitude, altitude.

name: TACAN ACTIVE CHANNEL:index
description: The active channel used by the indexed Tacan receiver on the aircraft, from 1 to 127.

name: TACAN ACTIVE MODE:index
description: The active mode used by the indexed Tacan receiver on the aircraft, where 0 = X and 1 = Y.

name: TACAN AVAILABLE:index
description: Will be TRUE (1) if NAV1, NAV2, NAV3 or NAV4 can receive Tacan (depending on the index - 1, 2, 3, or 4), or FALSE (0) otherwise.

name: TACAN DRIVES NAV1:index
description: Tells whether the Tacan is driving the Nav 1 indicator (TRUE, 1) or not (FALSE, 0), for autopilot purposes.

name: TACAN OBS:index
description: The Tacan OBS setting, in degrees.

name: TACAN STANDBY CHANNEL:index
description: The standby channel used by the indexed Tacan receiver on the aircraft, from 1 to 127.

name: TACAN STANDBY MODE:index
description: Indicates the indexed Tacan receiver standby mode, where 0 = X and 1 = Y.

name: TACAN STATION CDI:index
description: The CDI needle deflection amount(course deviation) to the station. Can be +/- 127.

name: TACAN STATION DISTANCE:index
description: The distance between the Tacan station position and the aircraft position. The index value refers to the Tacan receiver connected to the station (1 or 2).

name: TACAN STATION IDENT:index
description: The tuned station identifier for the indexed Tacan.

name: TACAN STATION LATLONALT:index
description: Retrieves the latitude, longitude and altitude of the Tacan station.

name: TACAN STATION RADIAL:index
description: The radial between the Tacan station and the aircraft.

name: TACAN STATION RADIAL ERROR:index
description: Difference between the current radial and OBS tuned radial, in degrees.

name: TACAN STATION TOFROM:index
description: Returns whether the indexed Tacan is going to or from the current radial (or is off).

name: TACAN VOLUME:index
description: The volume value of the indexed Tacan receiver on the aircraft.

name: COPILOT TRANSMITTER TYPE
description: On which channel the copilot is transmitting.
unit:

0 = COM1
1 = COM2
2 = COM3
3 = TEL
4 = NONE

name: COPILOT TRANSMITTING
description: Whether or not the copilot is transmitting.

name: PILOT TRANSMITTER TYPE
description: On which channel the pilot is transmitting.
unit:
Enum:

0 = COM1
1 = COM2
2 = COM3
3 = TEL
4 = NONE

name: PILOT TRANSMITTING
description: Whether or not the pilot is transmitting.

description: Currently not used within the simulation.

name: RADIO HEIGHT
