name: TRANSPONDER AVAILABLE
description: True if a transponder is available.

name: TRANSPONDER CODE:index
description: 4-digit code.

name: TRANSPONDER IDENT
description: This can set the Ident transponder using the KEY_XPNDR_IDENT_SET, KEY_XPNDR_IDENT_TOGGLE, KEY_XPNDR_IDENT_ON or KEY_XPNDR_IDENT_OFF Event IDs (see XPNDR (Transponder) section for more information). When set to true, it will automatically turn false after 18 seconds.

name: TRANSPONDER STATE
description: Transponder State.
unit:
Enum:

0 = Off
1 = Standby
2 = Test
3 = On
4 = Alt
5 = Ground

description: True if the fire bottle switch is on.

name: GLASSCOCKPIT AUTOMATIC BRIGHTNESS
description: This variable will return a value between 0 and 1 for the automatic brightness setting for glass cockpit displays, where 0 is the dimmest and 1 is the brightest. This value will vary depending on the time of day.

name: GPWS SYSTEM ACTIVE
description: True if the Ground Proximity Warning System is active.

name: GPWS WARNING

name: GYRO DRIFT ERROR
description: Angular error of heading indicator.

name: HAS STALL PROTECTION
description: Will return whether the aircraft has stall protection (true) or not (false).

name: HEADING INDICATOR
description: Heading indicator (directional gyro) indication.

name: INDICATED ALTITUDE
description: The indicated altitude.

name: INDICATED ALTITUDE CALIBRATED
description: Indicated altitude with the altimeter calibrated to current sea level pressure.

name: INDICATED ALTITUDE EX1
description: Similar to INDICATED_ALTITUDE but doesn't affect actual plane position when setting this variable.

name: INDUCTOR COMPASS HEADING REF
description: Inductor compass heading.

name: INDUCTOR COMPASS PERCENT DEVIATION
description: Inductor compass deviation reading.

name: INSTRUMENTS AVAILABLE
description: Deprecated, do not use!

name: INTERCOM MODE
description: Intercom Mode

name: INTERCOM SYSTEM ACTIVE
description: Whether or not the intercom system is active.

name: IS ALTITUDE FREEZE ON
description: True if the altitude of the aircraft is frozen.

name: IS ATTITUDE FREEZE ON
description: True if the attitude (pitch, bank and heading) of the aircraft is frozen.

name: IS LATITUDE LONGITUDE FREEZE ON
description:
True if the lat/lon of the aircraft (either user or AI controlled) is frozen. If this variable returns true, it means that the latitude and longitude of the aircraft are not being controlled by ESP, so enabling, for example, a SimConnect client to control the position of the aircraft. This can also apply to altitude and attitude.

          Also refer to the range of KEY_FREEZE..... Event IDs.

name: KOHLSMAN SETTING HG:index
description:
The value for the given altimeter index in inches of mercury.
IMPORTANT! In the system.cfg file, altimeters are indexed from 0, but the SimVar indexes from 1. So, altimeter 0 in that file is accessed using KOHLSMAN SETTING HG:1, 1 by KOHLSMAN SETTING HG:2, etc...

name: KOHLSMAN SETTING MB:index
description:
The value for the given altimeter index in millibars.
IMPORTANT! In the system.cfg file, altimeters are indexed from 0, but the SimVar indexes from 1. So, altimeter 0 in that file is accessed using KOHLSMAN SETTING MB:1, 1 by KOHLSMAN SETTING MB:2, etc...

name: KOHLSMAN SETTING STD:index
description:
True if the indexed altimeter is in "Standard" mode, or false otherwise.
IMPORTANT! In the system.cfg file, altimeters are indexed from 0, but the SimVar indexes from 1. So, altimeter 0 in that file is accessed using KOHLSMAN SETTING STD:1, 1 by KOHLSMAN SETTING STD:2, etc...

name: MAGNETIC COMPASS
description: Compass reading.

name: MANUAL FUEL PUMP HANDLE
description: Position of manual fuel pump handle. 1 is fully deployed.

name: OVERSPEED WARNING
description: Overspeed warning state.

name: PANEL ANTI ICE SWITCH

description: Amount of pitot ice. 100 is fully iced.

Smoke system available.

Deprecated, do not use!

The variometer rate using total energy.
Total Energy = Potential Energy + Kinetic Energy

name: WARNING FUEL

description: This is the current state of the left fuel tank warning, either on (true) or off (false).

name: DISK BANK ANGLE:index

Rotor bank angle of the given rotor index. Index should be specified to 1 for main rotor and 2 for tail rotor.

name: DISK BANK PCT:index
description:
Rotor bank percent of the given rotor index. Index should be specified to 1 for main rotor and 2 for tail rotor.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: DISK CONING PCT:index
description:
Rotor coning percent of the given rotor index. Index should be specified to 1 for main rotor and 2 for tail rotor.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: DISK PITCH ANGLE:index
description:
Rotor pitch angle of the given rotor index. Index should be specified to 1 for main rotor and 2 for tail rotor.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: DISK PITCH PCT:index
description:
Rotor pitch percent of the given rotor index. Index should be specified to 1 for main rotor and 2 for tail rotor.

name: ROTOR COLLECTIVE BLADE PITCH PCT

The rotor collective blade pitch.

name: ROTOR CYCLIC BLADE MAX PITCH POSITION
description:
The position (angle) at which blade has the maximum cyclic pitch.

name: ROTOR CYCLIC BLADE PITCH PCT
description:
The rotor cyclic blade (maximum) pitch.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: ROTOR GOV ACTIVE

description:
The rotor lateral trim percentage.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: ROTOR LONGITUDINAL TRIM PCT
description:
The rotor longitudinal trim percentage.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: ROTOR ROTATION ANGLE:index
description:
Rotor rotation angle of the given rotor index. Index should be specified to 1 for main rotor and 2 for tail rotor.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: ROTOR RPM:index
description:
The indexed rotor RPM.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: ROTOR RPM PCT:index
description: Percent max rated rpm of the given rotor index. Index should be specified to 1 for main rotor and 2 for tail rotor.

name: ROTOR TEMPERATURE
description: The main rotor transmission temperature.

name: STRUCT ROTOR POSITION:index
description: The position of the indexed rotor.

name: TAIL ROTOR BLADE PITCH PCT
description: The pitch position of the tailrotor blades.

name: TAIL ROTOR PEDAL POSITION
description: Percent tail rotor pedal deflection.

name: ENG ROTOR RPM:index
description:
Returns the indexed rotor RPM.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: ENG TORQUE PERCENT:index
description: Returns the indexed rotor torque.

name: IS ATTACHED TO SLING
description: Set to true if this object is attached to a sling.

name: NUM SLING CABLES
description: The number of sling cables (not hoists) that are configured for the helicopter.

name: SLING ACTIVE PAYLOAD STATION:index, param
description: The payload station (identified by the parameter) where objects will be placed from the sling (identified by the index).

name: SLING CABLE BROKEN:index
description: THis will be True (1) if the indexed cable is broken, or False (0) otherwise.

name: SLING CABLE EXTENDED LENGTH:index
description: The length of the indexed cable extending from the aircraft.

name: SLING HOIST PERCENT DEPLOYED:index
description: The percentage of the full length of the sling cable deployed.

name: SLING HOIST SWITCH:index
description: This will be True (1) if the hoist is enabled or False (0) otherwise.

name: SLING HOOK IN PICKUP MODE
description: This will be True (1) if the hook is in pickup mode or False (0) otherwise. When True, the hook will be capable of picking up another object.

name: SLING OBJECT ATTACHED:index
description:
If the SimVar units are set as boolean, this will return True (1) if a sling object is attached, or False (0) otherwise.
If the SimVar units are set as a string, tis will return the container title of the object.
Note that there can be multiple sling positions, indexed from 1. The sling positions are set in the Aircraft Configuration File.

name: ENG ELECTRICAL LOAD:index
description: The electrical load on the indexed engine.

name: ENG FUEL PRESSURE:index
description: The fuel pressure for the indexed engine.

name: ENG TRANSMISSION PRESSURE:index
description: The transmission pressure of the indexed engine.

name: ENG TRANSMISSION TEMPERATURE:index
description: The transmission temperature of the indexed engine.

name: ENG TURBINE TEMPERATURE:index
description: The tubine temperature for the indexed engine.

name: CAMERA GAMEPLAY PITCH YAW:index
description: Returns either the pitch (index 0) or the yaw (index 1) of the current gameplay camera.

name: CAMERA REQUEST ACTION
description: This can be used to have the currently active camera perform a predefined action. Currently only 1 action is supported, but more may be added over time.
unit:
Enum:

1 = Reset Active Camera (in VR this will recenter the headset view)

name: CAMERA STATE
description:
This can be used to get or set the camera "state", which will be one of the listed enum values.
Note that not ALL possible enum values are shown, since some values are internal only, and some values will do nothing, but have been reserved for future expansion of the camera system.
Also note that the value "9" is a special case, generally used only when working with in-sim panels and is used to go to the showcase cameras, defaulting to the last selected camera within this section (Drone, Fixed or Environment).
unit:
Enum:

2 = Cockpit
3 = External/Chase
4 = Drone
5 = Fixed on Plane
6 = Environment
7 = Six DoF
8 = Gameplay
9 = Showcase
10 = Drone Aircraft
11 = Waiting
12 = World Map
13 = Hangar RTC
14 = Hangar Custom
15 = Menu RTC
16 = In-Game RTC
17 = Replay
19 = Drone Top-Down
21 = Hangar
24 = Ground
25 = Follow Traffic Aircraft

name: CAMERA SUBSTATE
description: This variable can be used to get or set the camera "sub-state". The options here are generally only required when working with the in-sim panel UI. Note that the "locked" and "unlocked" state will be changed automatically if the following SimVars have their values changed: COCKPIT_CAMERA_HEADLOOK, CHASE_CAMERA_HEADLOOK.
unit:
Enum:

1 = Locked (Fixed look or chase lock -

                The camera is locked in position)
2 = Unlocked (Head look or Chase

                normal - The camera is "attached" to

                the mouse)
3 = Quickview (the camera is

                currently using a Quickview)
4 = Smart (The camera has Smart

                camera active)
5 = Instrument (The camera is

                focused on an instruments panel)

name: CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX:index
description:
With this you can get or set both the type of view for the current camera, as well as the option index, which will be between 0 and the maximum index value (as retrieved using the CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX MAX SimVar). Supplying an index of 0 to the SimVar will get/set the type (from the selection of enum values listed), and using an index of 1 will get/set the option index, which is an integer value.
 
Please see the Notes On View Types And Indices section below for more information.
unit:
Enum (index = 0):

0 = Unknown/default
(External / Chase and Showcase /

                Drone / Fixed / Environment states)
1 = Pilot View
(Cockpit State)
2 = Instruments
(Cockpit State)
3 = Quickview
(Cockpit State)
4 = Quickview External
(External State)
5 = View
(Showcase / Drone / Fixed /

                Environment states)

or
Number (index = 1)

name: CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX MAX:index
description:
This variable can get the number of option indices related to a specific camera view type. The index value supplied to the SimVar should be one of the camera view type Enum values (see CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX), and the SimVar will return the number of options available for that camera type (counting from 1, so - for example - if the camera view type is "Quickview" and has 8 quickview settings, then CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX MAX:4 will return 8). Note that this value can be set after a flight has started, but it will have no effect since the number of camera options is initilaised once only and not updated (and the simulation may overwrite the value again even after setting it).
 
Please see the Notes On View Types And Indices section below for more information.

name: GAMEPLAY CAMERA FOCUS
description:
This gets/sets the focus for the camera zoom, which can be either manual, or auto. The setting affects both the Cockpit and the External (Chase) cameras.
          The following SimVars can be used to get/set the level of zoom: COCKPIT_CAMERA_ZOOM or CHASE_CAMERA_ZOOM.

name: IS CAMERA RAY INTERSECT WITH NODE
description: This SimVar is used to check for a collision along a ray from the center of the user FOV and a model node. The available nodes that can be checked using this SimVar must be previously defined in the [CAMERA_RAY_NODE_COLLISION] of the cameras.cfg file. The SimVar requires a node index value between 1 and 10, corresponding to the node defined in the CFG file, and the SimVar will return 1 (TRUE) if there is a collision along the camera ray or 0 (FALSE) otherwise. You may also supply an index of 0 to perform a collision check for all defined nodes, in which case the SimVar will return 1 (TRUE) if there is a collision between the ray and any of the defined nodes. Supplying an index outside of the range of 1 to 10, or supplying an index for which no node has been defined, will return 0 (FALSE).

name: CHASE CAMERA HEADLOOK
description: This is used to get/set the look state of the chase (external) camera. Note that this value will also affect the CAMERA_SUBSTATE value, when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 3 (External/Chase).

name: CHASE CAMERA MOMENTUM
description: Sets/gets the momentum modifier of the chase (external) camera, which is controls how fast/slow the camera will stop moving when no longer being moved by the user. Default is 50%.

name: CHASE CAMERA SPEED
description: Sets/gets the translation speed modifier of the chase (external) camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

name: CHASE CAMERA ZOOM
description: Sets/gets the zoom/FOV modifier for the chase (external) camera. Note that when setting this value, it will affect the camera regardless of whether the GAMEPLAY_CAMERA_FOCUS is set to manual or automatic. Default is 50%.

name: CHASE CAMERA ZOOM SPEED
description: Sets/gets the speed modifier for when the zoom/FOV chase (external) camera changes zoom/FOV levels. Default is 50%.

name: CAMERA ACTION COCKPIT VIEW RESET
description: This can be used to reset the cockpit camera when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 2 (Cockpit). Essentially the same as the user pressing the default reset keys CTRL + Space.

name: CAMERA ACTION COCKPIT VIEW SAVE:index
description: This can be used to save a cockpit camera when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 2 (Cockpit). The index value given is the save "slot" that will be used, from 0 to 9. Essentially this is the same as the user pressing the default save keys CTRL + Alt + 0-9.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA HEADLOOK
description: This is used to get/set the look state of the cockpit camera. Note that this value will also affect the CAMERA_SUBSTATE value, when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 2 (Cockpit).

name: COCKPIT CAMERA HEIGHT
description: This can be used to get/set the cockpit camera height modifier expressed as a percentage. Default is 50%.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA INSTRUMENT AUTOSELECT
description: This can be used to get or set the autoselect option for the cockpit camera when viewing the instruments (ie: the CAMERA_SUBSTATE is 5). When enabled the camera will move automatically if the player mouse reaches the edge of the screen and there are instrument panels available on that side.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA MOMENTUM
description: Sets/gets the momentum modifier of the cockpit camera, which is controls how fast/slow the camera will stop moving when no longer being moved by the user. Default is 50%.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA SIDE
description: Not currently used in the simulation.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA SPEED
description: Sets/gets the translation speed modifier of the cockpit camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA UPPER POSITION
description: Sets/gets the current "upper position" cockpit camera toggle. When 1 (TRUE), the camera is is in the upper position, and when 0 (FALSE) it is in the default position.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA ZOOM
description: Sets/gets the zoom/FOV modifier for the cockpit camera. Note that when setting this value, it will affect the camera regardless of whether the GAMEPLAY_CAMERA_FOCUS is set to manual or automatic. Default is 50%.

name: COCKPIT CAMERA ZOOM SPEED
description: Sets/gets the speed modifier for when the zoom/FOV cockpit camera changes zoom/FOV levels. Default is 50%.

name: DRONE CAMERA FOCUS
description: Sets/gets the focus modifier for the drone camera. Default is 50%, and a lower value will set the drone focus to things in the foreground and a higher level will set the drone focus to things in the background. Note that this is only taken into account when the DRONE_CAMERA_FOCUS_MODE is set to 3 (manual).

name: DRONE CAMERA FOCUS MODE
description: Sets/gets the current drone focus mode. When set to 3 (manual), the focus position will be based on the DRONE_CAMERA_FOCUS value.

name: DRONE CAMERA FOLLOW
description: Sets/gets the whether the drone camera is in follow mode or not.

name: DRONE CAMERA FOV
description: Sets/gets the zoom/FOV modifier for the drone camera. Default is 50%.

name: DRONE CAMERA LOCKED
description: Sets/gets the whether the drone camera is locked or not.

name: DRONE CAMERA SPEED ROTATION
description: Sets/gets the rotation speed modifier of the drone camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

name: DRONE CAMERA SPEED TRAVELLING
description: Sets/gets the translation speed modifier of the drone camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

name: SMART CAMERA ACTIVE
description: Sets/gets the whether the smart camera is active or not.

name: SMART CAMERA INFO:index
description:
Gets information on the smartcam system. The index sets what kind of information will be returned (or set):

0 = Gets the number of smartcam targets in the smart camera list
1 = Gets or sets the index of the currently selected smartcam target, counting from 0 (so index 0 is the first target in the list).

name: SMART CAMERA LIST:index
description: Retrieves the type of target for the indexed position in the smartcam list, counting from 0 (so index 0 is the first target in the list).
unit:
Enum:

0 = unknown POI
1 = Follow POI
2 = User POI
3 = General POI
4 = End OF Runway
5 = Landing Runway
6 = Flightpath
7 = Object Interaction
8 = Multiplayer OOI
9 = Active Runway
10 = Waypoint
11 = Airport OOI
12 = Flight Assistant Destination

name: SMART CAMERA LIST DESCRIPTION:index
description: This returns a localized string that represents the smartcam target specified by the given index. Indices count from 0 so index 0 is the first target in the list.

name: ANIMATION DELTA TIME
description: Difference of time between the current frame and the last frame where this SimObject has been animated

name: ARTIFICIAL GROUND ELEVATION
description: In case scenery is not loaded for AI planes, this variable can be used to set a default surface elevation.

name: CATEGORY
description:
One of the following:
          
"Airplane",
"Helicopter",
"Boat",
"GroundVehicle",
"ControlTower",
"SimpleObject",
"Viewer"

name: CONTROLLABLE
CRASH FLAG

1:[index] complete
3:[index] reset
4:[index] pause
11:[index] start

name: GROUND ALTITUDE
description: Altitude of surface.

name: HAND ANIM STATE
description: What frame of the hand is currently used.

11 = Hold yokes

name: IDLE ANIMATION ID
description: The ID of the idle animation for the sim object.

name: MAGVAR
description: Magnetic variation.

name: MISSION SCORE
REALISM
description: General realism percent.

name: REALISM CRASH DETECTION
description: True indicates crash detection is turned on.

name: REALISM CRASH WITH OTHERS
description: True indicates crashing with other aircraft is possible.

name: SIM DISABLED
description: Is sim disabled.

name: SIM ON GROUND
description:
On ground flag.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: SIM SHOULD SET ON GROUND
TRACK IR ENABLE

name: TOTAL WORLD VELOCITY
description: Speed relative to the earths center.

name: USER INPUT ENABLED
description: Is input allowed from the user.

name: VISUAL MODEL RADIUS
description: Model radius.

name: VELOCITY WORLD X
description:
Speed relative to earth, in East/West direction.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: VELOCITY WORLD Y
description:
Speed relative to earth, in vertical direction.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: VELOCITY WORLD Z
description:
Speed relative to earth, in North/South direction.
NOTE: This is available in multiplayer to all far aircraft. See here for more information: Note On SimVars In Multiplayer.

name: AMBIENT DENSITY
description: Ambient density.

name: AMBIENT PRECIP RATE
description: The current precipitation rate.

name: AMBIENT PRECIP STATE
description: The current state of precipitation.

name: AMBIENT PRESSURE
description: Ambient pressure.

name: AMBIENT TEMPERATURE
description: Ambient temperature.

name: AMBIENT VISIBILITY
description: Ambient visibility (only measures ambient particle visibility - related to ambient density).

name: AMBIENT WIND DIRECTION
description: Wind direction, relative to true north.

name: AMBIENT WIND VELOCITY
description: Wind velocity.

name: AMBIENT WIND X
description: Wind component in East/West direction.

name: AMBIENT WIND Y
description: Wind component in vertical direction.

name: AMBIENT WIND Z
description: Wind component in North/South direction.

name: BAROMETER PRESSURE
description: Barometric pressure.

name: DENSITY ALTITUDE
description:
The density altitude is the altitude relative to standard atmospheric conditions at which the air density would be equal to the indicated air density at the place of observation. The calculation is as follows:
density_altitude = pressure_altitude + 118.8 * (outside_air_temp - ISA_temp)

name: SEA LEVEL PRESSURE
description: Barometric pressure at sea level.

name: STRUCT AMBIENT WIND
description: X (latitude), Y (vertical) and Z (longitude) components of the wind.

name: AI DESIRED SPEED
description: The desired speed of the AI object.

name: AI WAYPOINT LIST
description: A list of waypoints that an AI controlled object should follow.

name: AI CURRENT WAYPOINT
description: The current waypoint in the list.

name: AI DESIRED HEADING
description: The desired heading of the AI object.

name: AI GROUNDTURNTIME
description: The time required by the AI aircraft to make a 90º turn.

name: AI GROUNDCRUISESPEED
description: The ground cruising speed for the AI aircraft.

name: AI GROUNDTURNSPEED
description: The ground turning speed for the AI aircraft.

name: AI TRAFFIC ISIFR
description: This can be used to request whether the AI aircraft is IFR or VFR. Note that if an aircraft does not have a flight plan, the value returned will be 0 (or false).

name: AI TRAFFIC STATE
description:
This will return a string describing an AI aircraft state. If the aircraft is under ATC control the string will be one of the following:

"init"
"sleep"
"flt plan"
"startup"
"preflight support"
"clearance"
"push back 1"
"push back 2"
"pre taxi out"
"taxi out"
"takeoff 1"
"takeoff 2"
"T&G depart"
"enroute"
"pattern"
"landing"
"rollout"
"go around"
"taxi in"
"shutdown"
"postflight support" 

 
If the aircraft is not under ATC control, the string will be one of these:

"Sleep"
"Waypoint"
"Takeoff"
"Landing"
"Taxi"

 
Note that if an aircraft does not have a flight plan, the value returned will be an empty string "".

name: AI TRAFFIC CURRENT AIRPORT
description: The ICAO code of the current airport. If an aircraft does not have a flight plan, the value returned will be an empty string "".

name: AI TRAFFIC ASSIGNED RUNWAY
description: The assigned runway name (for example: "32R"). If an aircraft does not have a flight plan, the value returned will be an empty string "".

name: AI TRAFFIC ASSIGNED PARKING
description:
The assigned parking name. The string will take the form:
Name + Number, Type ( radius )
For example:

"Ramp 1, RAMP sml (10m)"
"Gate G 4, RAMP lrg (18m)"

If an aircraft does not have a flight plan, the value returned will be an empty string "".

name: AI TRAFFIC FROMAIRPORT
description:
The ICAO code of the departure airport in the current schedule. 
This variable is only valid for aircraft generated by the traffic database that have schedules. If an aircraft does not have a schedule, the value returned will an empty string"".

name: AI TRAFFIC TOAIRPORT
description:
The ICAO code of the destination airport in the current schedule. 
This variable is only valid for aircraft generated by the traffic database that have schedules. If an aircraft does not have a schedule, the value returned will an empty string"".

name: AI TRAFFIC ETD
description:
The estimated time of departure for the current schedule entry, given as the number of seconds difference from the current simulation time. This can be negative if ETD is earlier than the current simulation time
This variable is only valid for aircraft generated by the traffic database that have schedules. If an aircraft does not have a schedule, the value returned will be 0.

name: AI TRAFFIC ETA
description:
Estimated time of arrival for the current schedule entry, given as the number of seconds difference from the current simulated time. This can be negative if ETA is earlier than the current simulated time.
This variable is only valid for aircraft generated by the traffic database that have schedules. If an aircraft does not have a schedule, the value returned will be 0.

name: STRUCT DAMAGEVISIBLE
description: Deprecated, do not use!

name: STRUCT PBH32
description: Returns a pitch, bank and heading value (for what will depend on the SimVar being used).

name: STRUCT REALISM VARS
description: Not currently used in the simulation.

name: STRUCT SURFACE RELATIVE VELOCITY
description: The relative surface velocity.

name: STRUCT WORLDVELOCITY
description: The world velocity.

name: STRUCT WORLD ACCELERATION
description: The world acceleration for each axis. Individual world acceleration values are in the Aircraft Position and Speed section.
unit: SIMCONNECT_DATA_XYZ structure, feet per second squared

name: STRUCT WORLD ROTATION VELOCITY
description: The world rotation velocity.

name: BOMB AMMO
description: The amount of bomb ammunition available.

name: CANNON AMMO
description: The amount of cannon ammunition available.

name: GUN AMMO
description: The amount of gun ammunition available.

name: ROCKET AMMO
description: The amount of rocket ammunition available.

name: BAGGAGELOADER ANGLE CURRENT
description: Current angle of the baggage loader ramp, relative to the ground.

name: BAGGAGELOADER ANGLE TARGET
description: Target angle of the baggage loader ramp, relative to the ground.

name: BAGGAGELOADER END RAMP Y
description: "Y" axis position of the end of the baggage loader ramp, relative to the ground.

name: BAGGAGELOADER END RAMP Z
description: "Z" axis position of the end of the baggage loader ramp, relative to the ground.

name: BAGGAGELOADER PIVOT Y
description: "Y" axis position of the baggage loader ramp pivot, relative to the ground.

name: BAGGAGELOADER PIVOT Z
description: "Z" axis position of the baggage loader ramp pivot, relative to the ground.

name: BOARDINGRAMP ELEVATION CURRENT
description: The current altitude AGL of the top of the boarding ramp stairs.

name: BOARDINGRAMP ELEVATION TARGET
description: The target altitude AGL of the top of the boarding ramp stairs.

name: BOARDINGRAMP END POSITION Y
description: The "Y" axis position of the top of the boarding ramp stairs when extended at maximal capacity, relative to the ground.

name: BOARDINGRAMP END POSITION Z
description: The "Z" axis position of the top of the boarding ramp stairs when extended at maximal capacity, relative to the ground.

name: BOARDINGRAMP ORIENTATION CURRENT
description: The current orientation of the boarding ramp stairs, where 0 is at rest and 1 is suited for boarding.

name: BOARDINGRAMP ORIENTATION TARGET
description: The target orientation of of the boarding ramp stairs, where 0 is at rest and 1 is suited for boarding.

name: BOARDINGRAMP START POSITION Y
description: The "Y" axis position of the top of the boarding ramp stairs when at minimal extension, relative to the ground.

name: BOARDINGRAMP START POSITION Z
description: The "Z" axis position of the top of the boarding ramp stairs when at minimal extension, relative to the ground.

name: CATERINGTRUCK AIRCRAFT DOOR CONTACT OFFSET Z
description: The "Z" axis position of the point of contact between the catering truck and the bottom of the aircraft door, relative to the ground.

name: CATERINGTRUCK ELEVATION CURRENT
description: The current altitude AGL of the bottom of the catering truck container.

name: CATERINGTRUCK ELEVATION TARGET
description: The target altitude AGL of the bottom of the catering truck container.

name: CATERINGTRUCK OPENING CURRENT
description: The current state of the catering truck when opening the container and deploying the bridge, where 0 is fully closed and 1 is fully opened and deployed.

name: CATERINGTRUCK OPENING TARGET
description: The target state of the catering truck the container is opene and the bridge deployed, where 0 is fully closed and 1 is fully opened and deployed.

name: FUELTRUCK HOSE DEPLOYED
description: The current deployment amount of the fuel truck hose. Currently can only be set to 0 (not deployed) and 1 (deployed).

name: FUELTRUCK HOSE END POSX
description: The "X" axis position of the end of the fuel truck hose when fully deployed, relative to the ground.

name: FUELTRUCK HOSE END POSZ
description: The "Z" axis position of the end of the fuel truck hose when fully deployed, relative to the ground.

name: FUELTRUCK HOSE END RELATIVE HEADING
description: The heading of the end of the fuel truck hose, relative to the vehicle heading.

name: GROUNDPOWERUNIT HOSE DEPLOYED
description: The current deployment amount of the ground power unit hose. Currently can only be set to 0 (not deployed) and 1 (deployed).

name: GROUNDPOWERUNIT HOSE END POSX
description: The "X" axis position of the end of the ground power unit hose when fully deployed, relative to the ground.

name: GROUNDPOWERUNIT HOSE END POSZ
description: The "Z" axis position of the end of the ground power unit hose when fully deployed, relative to the ground.

name: GROUNDPOWERUNIT HOSE END RELATIVE HEADING
description: The heading of the end of the ground power unit hose, relative to the vehicle heading.

name: JETWAY HOOD LEFT BEND
description: The target position for the left bend animation of the jetway hood.

name: JETWAY HOOD LEFT DEPLOYMENT
description: The target angle for the left deployment animation of the jetway hood, where 0 is considered vertical.

name: JETWAY HOOD RIGHT BEND
description: The target position for the right bend animation of the jetway hood.

name: JETWAY HOOD RIGHT DEPLOYMENT
description: The target angle for the right deployment animation of the jetway hood, where 0 is considered vertical.

name: JETWAY HOOD TOP HORIZONTAL
description: Target position for the top horizontal animation of the jetway hood. Values can be between -100% and 100%.

name: JETWAY HOOD TOP VERTICAL
description: Target position for the top vertical animation of the jetway hood. Values can be between -100% and 100%.

name: JETWAY MOVING
description: This will be 1 (TRUE) id the jetway body is currently moving (it will not include checks on hood animation).

name: JETWAY WHEEL ORIENTATION CURRENT
description: The current angle of the jetway wheels.

name: JETWAY WHEEL ORIENTATION TARGET
description: The (approximate) target angle for the jetway wheels.

name: JETWAY WHEEL SPEED
description: The current speed of the jetway wheels.

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT DIRECTION PARKINGSPACE
description: Currently not used in the simulation.

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT DISTANCE
description: The distance between the Marshaller and the aircraft.

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT DISTANCE DIRECTION X PARKINGSPACE
description: Position on the X axis of the aircraft in the parking space (negative means the aircraft is on the left side and positive the right side).

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT DISTANCE DIRECTION Z PARKINGSPACE
description: Position on the Z axis of the aircraft in the parking space (negative means the aircraft is behind the parking space and positive is in front of the parking space).

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT ENGINE SHUTDOWN
description: True if the engine(s) of the aircraft is (are) shut down.

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT HEADING PARKINGSPACE
description: Angle between the direction of the aircraft and the direction of the parking place.

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT PROJECTION POINT PARKINGSPACE
description: Value in Z axis of the projection from the aircraft position following the heading of the aircraft.

name: MARSHALLER AIRCRAFT VELOCITY
description: The velocity of the aircraft.

name: PUSHBACK ANGLE
description: Pushback angle (the heading of the tug).

name: PUSHBACK ATTACHED
description: True if this vehicle is attached to an aircraft.

name: PUSHBACK AVAILABLE
description: True if a push back is available on the parking space.

name: PUSHBACK CONTACTX
description: The towpoint position, relative to the aircrafts datum reference point.

name: PUSHBACK CONTACTY
description: Pushback contact position in vertical direction.

name: PUSHBACK CONTACTZ
description: Pushback contact position in fore/aft direction.

name: PUSHBACK STATE:index
description: Type of pushback.

name: PUSHBACK WAIT
description: True if waiting for pushback.

name: WAGON BACK LINK LENGTH
description: The length of the link at the back of the vehicle used to attach a wagon behind.

name: WAGON BACK LINK ORIENTATION
description: The current orientation of the link at the back of the vehicle used to attach a wagon behind.

name: WAGON BACK LINK START POSZ
description: The "Z" axis position of the start of the link at the back of the vehicle used to attach a wagon behind, relative to the ground.

name: WAGON FRONT LINK LENGTH
description: The length of the link at the front of the vehicle used to be attached as wagon.

name: WAGON FRONT LINK ORIENTATION
description: The current orientation of the link at the front of the vehicle used to be attached as wagon.

name: WAGON FRONT LINK START POSZ
description: The "Z" axis position of the start of the link at the front of the vehicle used to be attached as wagon, relative to the ground.
